txt.en: 'Detestable.'
'Greedy, corrupt monsters, everywhere!'
'Gareth, enough of this! It is not worth it. We will find our way elsewhere!'
'...I knew it would come to this.'
'I'll be happy to see these two trouble-makers cast out!'
'Good riddance, I say!'
'You! Why did the mayor ask us to come here?'
'Two less drains on my wallet.'
'If you give me your word you'll aid me now, that money down there is for you....'
'Gareth, please...let me handle this. Good patron, can you explain?'
'Thank you for agreeing to meet. I have sent word to the workers....'
'What is this about, sir? Did we do something wrong?'
'They should be arriving shortly, at which point I will need your assistance.'
'Mr. Rust here is trying to undermine me! I happen to know that he has confidential town records in his possession.'
'Good day, Mayor.'
'And you, Mr. Utteridge! I happen to know that you are guilty of involving our visitors in your petty concerns.'
'These offences have cost you both your jobs.'
'Our...our jobs? Please, Mayor Goodnough -- be reasonable!'
'How could you?!'
'Why do you waste your breath on civility, Daley? They are not worthy of it.'
'I expect no better from a troublemaker like you, Rust.'
'Let us meet again in town, and I'll give you due payment for your services!'
'But Utteridge! You? Telling your lies to our good patrons? Smearing my reputation to our guests?'
'Curse you, Goodnough! I've nothing to lose -- I'll make you rue your greedy ways!'
'I am afraid it is unpardonable. You are both relieved of your employment in this town!'
'Why do you waste your breath on civility, Daley? They are not worthy of it.'
'Curse you, Goodnough! I've nothing to lose -- I'll make you rue your greedy ways!'
'Bah! Enough of this.'
'You were wise in your choice of protector, Mayor. Come, Daley; there is nothing for us here....'
'Spiteful! Detestable!'
'You're right, Gareth. We will be better off, now, I think. Nothing is worth the folly we have seen today.'
'Ha! That went better than I expected. Thank you, friend.'
